document_title: Alcoholic cirrhosis: Symptoms, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
The first step in diagnosing alcoholic cirrhosis is a clinical examination, understanding the patient's medical history and living habits... After that, the patient will be assigned to diagnose alcoholic cirrhosis through tests. Other clinical trials such as:
Blood tests: Including blood formula tests, electrolyte tests, assessment of blood clotting levels, liver function tests, etc.; Blood tests: Including blood formula tests, electrolyte tests, assessment of blood clotting levels, liver function tests, etc.
Liver enzyme test: To determine the concentration of three types of gamma liver enzymes - glutamyltransferase (GGT), aspartate aminotransferase (AST) and alanine aminotransferase (ALT). In people with alcoholic cirrhosis, AST is twice as high as ALT; Liver enzyme test: To determine the concentration of three types of gamma liver enzymes - glutamyltransferase (GGT), aspartate aminotransferase (AST) and alanine aminotransferase (ALT). In people with alcoholic cirrhosis, AST is twice as high as ALT
Liver ultrasound and liver elasticity measurements help assess the degree of fibrosis of the liver and abdomen; Liver ultrasound and liver elasticity measurements help assess the degree of fibrosis of the liver and abdomen
CT scan, MRI: These are diagnostic imaging techniques, providing detailed images of liver condition, thereby assessing the level of liver damage; CT scan, magnetic resonance imaging MRI: These are diagnostic imaging techniques that provide detailed images of liver condition, thereby assessing the level of liver damage.
